z5bM3YV6Ukk_OyC77Yle8g.text: Ya know, I haven't been to Zack's in a while so today for lunch, I...... went to Zack's. It's been a while since I've been there but the food was really good... and cheap! Zacks Special for $4.55 (double chz burger & fries) and I got some o-rings since I've never had them but heard good things aboot them.  The onion rings were  hot & good but nothing to write home about. (I prefer the onion rings from The Beacon Drive In, my favorites) The burger was juicy & hot and the fries were shoestring fries, not my favorite cut for fries, but they were really good nonetheless. I opted not to get a shake since I'm 'attempting' to watch what I'm eating but I've had their milkshakes in the past and they were like the girls in a Lil Wayne video - thick & had to use a spoon....  When I got there, the line stretched around the corner to, what felt like, Ft. Mill and I was at the end of it. But they zipped through the line and I got my goodies in a timely fashion.  Bottomline ~ A good place to go and eat on the cheap. Been in CLT for decades... nostalgic. A good place to go for a change of pace or a quick lunch. I just wish they'd pave their parking lot.

7AAMLC9-DFpYCcreAv9sxw.text: Zack's is OG in the hamburger game.  I love places like this.  Nothing special on appearance and food, but yet there is something so special about a place that has history.  The burger was good and I liked the shoestring fries.  The price is cheap as all hell.  Every once in a while a few of us at work hit this place up for lunch.  It seems to just be one of our go to spots. Don't expect a kobe patty or anything, just an old fashioned hamburger place.

ugd9ecnVoS0AG9LAqMYqcg.text: My earliest childhood memories include trips to Zack's, it was always a treat...and still is. GREAT VALUE! Plus, the owners are always present, quality is always consistent and good, no corners are cut during any part of the process. Staff is always friendly, efficient and courteous. There is always a line, but never a wait. One recent observation: Zack's has the lowest employee turnover of any restaurant I've ever seen. Happy employees say so much about a business, and they produce great food. I'm always pleased to see Zack's sustained and growing success, keep up the good work!

9w36I7BE1s953NISOLhGqg.text: Great burgers, great steaks! The only thing that fell short for me was the hot dog. As a northerner I tend to only like certain all beef hot dogs. But overall, I love this place! Shakes and all!

osQJTJs9MbKCZeIev7gF6w.text: Quintessential America!  The Zack's special is a doublr cheeseburger that the Big Mac can olny wish to be...Cheese, special sauce, toasted bun, lettuce, tomato, pickle, and chopped onions.  The fries are fine and delicately crisp, salted perfectly.  Definitely leave room for a shake (but get a small one). Lunch on a Wednesday shows the entire cross-section of Charlotte from hoopties with big shiny dubs discharging nappy headed guys from the 'hood to badge toting office drones.   The location is timeless American with a big glass box fronted by picnic tables sporting fibreglass sun shades.

3v9aZsR47-GSi69BWB1pAg.text: Food glorious Food Hot Onion Rings yummy. Special Sauce and again an old timey family business the kind of place you want to go over and over and over

XOVJKuFddIdEgtBMikaqiQ.text: Wow. This, by far, was the most "pure" burger that I've ever had. It makes me think that this is really how it tasted back in the 1950's. In-N-Out comes close, but has some extra stuff that Zack's does not.  I had my very first cherry milkshake in my life there. I may go back and try the banana.  The onion rings were so fresh, they burned my tongue. Fortunately, I had the milk shake.  Price is very reasonable. $2 for a cheeseburger. My total price for a double cheeseburger, onion rings, and milkshake after tax was $6.53.

iYRUufVRzPTmbpZKK8FnYQ.text: first off i am not a fan of this place at all. There are various places in charlotte with the same set up doing it way better. The onion rings where not what i expected greasy and lacking in flavor. My burger was sub par but i did enjoy my milkshake. Maybe it was just a bad day but it didn't win me over enough to ever come back.

ZMUYUGj8Gb10vNNWzToHwA.text: I'm always relieved to find that Zack's is still there!  and when we get to Charlotte (from Florida) it's always one of our first "stops".  Love it - from the time we lived "just around the corner" (Reynolds/Scaleybark, Annlin, Applegate) to these days from what-- 700 miles or more away!  wish Zack's was HERE.   Burger, Fish/Trout special, steak sandwich, onion rings, fries, slaw - it's allllll good!

28G6FY8zjpe0HF8lV7Zvhg.text: Cheap Cheap Cheap! and worth every penny!  This place should be a landmark, it's delicious and cheap.  Clark howard would love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. You should recognize!

Kvh0nb1lB72rI6aoDaK9ng.text: Keepin' it real.  Hit Zack's about 1pm and indeed it does a bustling lunch trade but it seemed to move 'em through pretty well.  There's certainly nothing upscale about it, but maybe that's part of the charm - it appears unchanged from some long ago time.  That time would be 1975 according to their sign, but you get the sense that in 1975 this still may have looked a bit retro...  or maybe more of the world really did look like this than I remember.  The Zack's special had a good fresh-made flavor in the classic style of old school burger joints.  Flavorful, but not overly seasoned.  I would say that the "special sauce" is a bit more subtle than the thinly disguised thousand island dressing on a Big Mac...  in fact, aside from a similar sounding bill of lading, nothing else in its flavor or appearance is reminiscent of a big mac at all - it's the anti-Big Mac as reviewer Anthony D. tagged it.  Chocolate malt was too thick to drink through a straw, but I'd still give the edge to Carolina Soda Shoppe on that item.  The fries are nothing special, but note that mine came unsalted which I kind of prefer to the over-salted fast food variety.  To me, fries are really just a vehicle for ketchup anyway so this is a non-issue.  Will return to taste around on the menu a bit.  Only potentially troubling thing I see is that the All Beef Hot Dogs list:  "Ketchup, mustard, onions, our own delicious chili" as toppings.  Ketchup?  And listed FIRST? Ketchup?  Slaw on a barbecue sandwich is controversial, but ketchup on a hot dog is just plain wrong if you're over the age of 12.  No less than Dirty Harry says "nobody, but nobody, puts ketchup on a hot dog".  Deeply troubling.  Not counting against them in this review, and assumed to be optional (they can't make me!!)

6adbwIAxzsZ30yli03idUg.text: I just stumbled upon Zack's recently and went there for lunch today. The burger and fries were great. My friend got an order of onion rings and they were just as good. The strawberry shake I got was fantastic as well.   Great old school burger place.

FQS4Lt6DcC0bHRwG9zkeqA.text: I love a good hamburger.  I  don't need anything super fancy--just a good burger, and I'm not that picky.  I was trying to figure out what I was in the mood to eat Friday night, no food in the house, and ALMOST walked down to Mr. K's when I realized I had never tried Zack's and someone here had given it a good review.   I love an old-school burger joint (old fashioned AND cheap) and this lived up to my expectations.  Everything was small, and I say that in a positive way.  The drinks weren't 50 ounces, the fries weren't in a bag the size of my head--everything was reasonable sized and reasonably priced.  I got a coke, a small fries, and a burger, and it was all tasty, hot, and delicious and inexpensive.  I'd definitely go back, and I'd say I prefer it to Mr. K's because Mr. K chargrills their burgers (I think) and I don't love the taste of char.  But still, either one satisfies my burger craving and I love giving them my money vs. 5 Guys or Wendy's or whatever major chain is around my neighborhood.

gRIbjn7ibXLQeB29LIyDjQ.text: Tastes and looks like the good ole days. I ordered the Zack Special (double cheeseburger) and onion rings. Delicious and at a good price. It felt going to the 1960's to eat. Totally worth it.

f9CiCVshuKdSWybbIIrvSg.text: I grew up eating zacks burgers, go by every time I come to charlotte

9LP9qMt1Q5SYl0En5NXtMQ.text: Great burgers!!! I ate mine and half my son's! Hey waste not want not it's in the Bible. It reminded me of when my mom would make burgers and butter the buns and grill/toast them. We stumbled upon this because we were waiting on our car to get serviced and it was within walking distance.  Highly recommend for a good cheap meal!!

sUZaw9uhFqR4sGj_WfQvfQ.text: The best burgers in Charlotte hands down! Seriously if you want a good old fashioned burger, go to Zack;s. The prices are unbeatable, and the food is out of this world amazing!

ByNf3JUrsS6kqdXbBKtZTw.text: Great price. Old-school classic American food. I love their fresh cut home-made onion rings, with a sweet tea containing crumbled ice. Add a hamburger and we're in business!

YJSSB5b5NSliixzB4a-cnQ.text: Great hamburger and more joint. Fish is actually presty good too and the iced tea is "real" southern sweet iced tea. The fries aren't my favorite but that's a personal prefences. The aerated ice makes a coke the perfect complement with a burger! Very buy during lunch!

KCnDxBsnM60ZoyPrJMffDg.text: I tried Zack's out on a Friday night after work.  I can see not being open on a Sunday, but not being open on a Saturday?  If that's what you want to do more power too them.  It was a beautiful day out and I was glad they had tables outside.  Zack's is a lot like the drive ins I've been to in other cities over my lifetime.  It's kind of run down and divey, but lots of good places are.  They were pretty busy and seemed a little frazzled behind the counter.  It took me a while to order even though there was one person ahead of me in line because when I got to the counter the server got a phone order and took it instead of waiting on me.  Pet peeve of mine, deal with the customers in front of you rather than those on the phone.  There were two other servers and a manager or owner back there that could have been taking phone orders.  I ordered a Zack's special, onion rings, and large shake.  I had to try the rings because those are one of my favorites things and they can show just how good a place is.  It didn't take too long to get my food and I head outside to sit on their patio.  I started with the rings and they were great.  They looked liked they used the same batter as on their chicken.   The burger looked like it was made fresh and not a frozen patty.  It was supposed to come with lettuce, tomato, pickles, onions, mayo, and special sauce.  Mine just had the lettuce, tomato and onion.  The beef was cooked well done but still juicy and not to greasy.  It was a good burger.  The fries were shoe string cut and crispy.  No complaints there.  I ordered a large shake, but it didn't seem very large.  Overall I would come back if nothing else for the onion rings.  The price is pretty reasonable too.

zhTF_fRy5amffZ5GLMmIvw.text: This is a cute little old school hamburger joint the price is great the food is great I always get a cheese burger and onion rings the hours of operation can be a lil funky though

q5an9_RI6Ls3VJXiiC9Z8g.text: This was my first and last time going to Zack's! The lady on register who I believe was the owner was uninviting. I asked how she was doing, got no response. She didn't  even look at me while I was placing my order. When I did receive my order the fries were cold and unseasoned, my burger bun was hard and dry. I also ordered a slice of pie, I hope that tastes good.

gOYC8vOAZrTzcu13m3USZA.text: Good service. Nice people. I had the sea food combo. It was ok but nothing outstanding. Should have got a burger.

RqWZDNIQqCrGVyqkJJFLEQ.text: Awesome burger joint. Think old school hang out. Great fried items as well. Onion rings rock!!  Need a little help on their desserts though but everything else was fantastic.

-WdUfYt2Hu95OPCpSzb6Qg.text: Place has been here since 1975 and is still one of the best in town. Service is great, food is great.  My favorite is the rib-eye steak sandwich.

35k5UfhI7eMERsaHSJ738Q.text: Really enjoyed the old dinner feel and a good sandwich with a root beer float.  My mom got the Zach's burger and a shake and said they were yummy too.

7AupxsV999OMlV5kbeZYxg.text: This place is great.  I've been in Charlotte for seven years and I love coming in here and getting almost a small town feel.  Change is good but this place is like your wonderful neighborhood diner.  The people that run it are awesome and so nice.  The burgers are tasty and I love the onion rings.  They've got a lot of choices so take your pick.  Cheers.

7xWwF6FA9tXhOwW0thJj2Q.text: I love this place. Trout sandwich is awesome. Quick service. A small amount of outdoor seating.

KCqXgUJuRwUFxA1Gvak9tg.text: I decided to try the Zack's special after all the hype in the reviews and I am here to say it was all I expected and more. 4  on the burger yumm. Now the fries I received were cold and not appealing, not to say they are good maybe in another space and time. Will I be back? Definitely.

qkr33iPgOvPhKFG2hZwvMw.text: Places like Zach's are few and far between, so it's nice to stumble upon a gem like this from time to time.  They have decent, inexpensive burgers and some awesome onion rings.    When you walk in the door, you definitely notice that it's an old-fashioned burger stand.  It has a few booths around and some bar stools lined around the edges.  I went there around lunch time, and the food was quick and fresh.  The burger itself was relatively small, like the size of a burger from a fast food restaurant.  However, the patty was much more flavorful.  The onion rings here are great as well.  The batter on them is light, crunchy, and perfectly seasoned.  They offer more than just burgers here, so it's nice if you want something like fried chicken, fish, hot dogs, or barbecue.  You can also get a milkshake to drink if the mood strikes.  Prices are a little higher than some place like McDonald's, but the food is so much better.  When I was here, it was very clean and the woman taking my order was polite and efficient.  I waited a little more than five minutes, but all my food was piping hot.  The best part was that it was under $6 for a cheeseburger and onion rings.  The only problem I really see is that they are only open Monday through Friday.  So, just make sure it's a weekday before you try to venture out to this place.

P40S1z3y9n3peyk-DBQNiA.text: Taking into consideration that I am actually one of the twelve people left that are from Charlotte and I still live here, I am officially ashamed that I never tried Zack's before yesterday...   The Zack's special was stupendous, guys... I ordered mine without mayo because that's how I get down, but there was still a great amount of toppings mixed all in with the two beef patties and cheese: tomatoes, pickles, onion, lettuce and secret sauce (which tastes quite a bit like thousand island dressing, so I think the secret is out)... I was really glad there wasn't any extra sauce because that sucker was already falling apart toward the end... In a good way, though... The bun was nice and toasty and wasn't bland, but didn't work too hard to prove itself by overpowering the other flavors...  The onion rings were pretty good... I'd liken them to Mr. K's down the block... Not too thick, not too thin... Decent batter, but not the cajun kind that comes on most onion straws... A basic, but tasty fried coating...   I even took this to go because I was heading home and everything traveled quite well... The food must have been practically on fire when they brought it out because it was still nice and hot by the time I arrived and got settled to eat... I didn't even have to do a quick microwave refresh!    I'm kind of afraid to take the boyfriend here... I doubt he'll want to go anywhere else for a while... But I just have to be the one to introduce this to someone new and I think he's the only one left that hasn't tried it...

TxsH5gzYRnutzXJUvkAhVQ.text: I think once you get past the nostalgia of the burger you realize they are just a decent burger. Nothing to go out of your way for, the prices are right and if you haven't tried them certainly judge for yourself. I am just not running back any time soon. Read more at eatitcharlotte.com/2017/...

UMjvLu1tl51PkN1bnV82sA.text: Not sure how this place has such high reviews. The Zacks Burger was pretty average. I got onion rings instead of fries. Again pretty average and lacking anything particularly interesting about them. Price was on the cheap side but i probably wont go back.

GZqs094PcryXygmKiJVFAA.text: The last time my dad was here, he raved about this place. He said it was definitely a must try!   Well, I finally was able to give this place a shot and I must admit, my dad totally got it right. This place was super cheap and delicious.   The place was packed, always a good sign durning lunch time! They prices are super cheap and they have daily specials. I went for a hotdog, order of onion rings and a chocolate milkshake.   The hot dog came covered with mustard, onions and their own chili. They serve it with ketchup too, but I don't believe in ruining a hotdog with ketchup...save it for the onion rings! But I digress, it was great. The toppings didn't overwhelm the bread or the hotdog and the flavors were just like they should have been. Classic. Yum!   The onion rings were freshly cut and hand breaded...Whoa...They were freaking delicious. Crispy, well battered and very tasty. A definite must try if you go. Seriously!   The milkshake was just okay. It wasn't thick and creamy and I really could have used more chocolate flavor. But considering that they have crushed ice...I just know next time to get a soda instead.   Overall, I really enjoyed this local joint. Major cool points to my dad for insisting I give Zack's a try!

Y3mDsV2OUz9gFEXjiAIUFQ.text: Just damn good burgers and fries. Stop in. You wont regret it. A Charlotte staple enjoyed by this Native Charlottean for years.

OdbUEv6anJLGW8scGIrdvw.text: I'm mad it took me this long to try this place. They have the best burger I've ever had in charlotte. I got the zacks special which comes with 2 parties, lettuce, tomato, pickles, American cheese, mayo, onions and special sauce. The special sauce is similar to McDonald's Big Mac sauce. It was amazing! Fries were not great however, I'll try onion rings next time.

8OiD3zNFuCQ4RgJ5oh5z-g.text: I do not know why it took me so long to stop in here. My life has been changed for the better by the Zack's Special. Perfect amount of every ingredient to where you get the "best" bite with every bite. Do not hit stop, do not pass this place by, go in and experience an amazing burger at an amazing price.   Why only 4 stars? The fries are just decent-- nothing special, and the "medium" size drink (which wouldn't matter if you were dining in and getting refills but does if you get takeout) is actually a small everywhere else. So order the large because their sweet tea is wonderful.

AQH_vgRxxEMTC9qbCAXCSg.text: This burger place is so good, it has a really cool old fashion feel and the food is so amazing and fresh. I got the double burger and fries and it was well worth 6$ i highly recommend to anybody !!!

odqEAJ21-LekzP8G0UubCQ.text: I ordered the zack's special due to one of my friends stating that it was the best burger in town. So I put my burger appetite to the challenge. And honestly, I wasn't amazed by it..   It was good, but not amazing from what people have said about this place. The atmosphere and prices were unbeatable by any means, but the burger was just okay. It was tasty and juicy, however not as big as I thought it was going to be. Note* I would come here if not for the location and how far it is from my house for a burger.  Other than that, it was pretty good. Sort of self service after you get your food, acted just like an old fast food joint.

9XIlnmWnvmXMxwKiozIipQ.text: We went there for the first time on Oct 20 and I was very disappointed. Have heard good things about their food. Heard their onion rings were supposed to be great. I found them lacking in taste. All I could taste was the batter and grease. Has the Hamburger Steak dinner. Over cooked hamburger with no seasoning. Ordered a medium soft drink and it was basically a small drink. For the price and value South 21 is hands down much better! Should have gone to South 21. Seriously doubt that we will ever go back to Zacks. Not with it at all.

WsT4ehF7JEJnIw3FA3TPkw.text: Made to Order Great Hamburger & FF, Fast Service and reasonable priced.  Outdoor Patio Seating.  This place is right out of the 60's, I felt like Time Stood Still !  ***Update*** months after our visit we saw this landmark burger joint on the popular TV show Homeland.

NJYkgkRSEyBuheCAdMY9CA.text: Love this hamburger joint on the south side of Uptown Charlotte. From the vintage style look of the building to the delicious hamburgers and cheeseburgers they serve I absolutely love this place. It is definitely one of the better burger joints around town and priced competitively. It's a great value for lunch and a lot friendlier service than what I usually get at the fast food restaurants. Highly recommend this place for lunch.

T3QWkdq2n6DTKdMl7vqxCw.text: Burger was fine, I expected a hand formed more homestyle patty I guess.  I also got the corn dog and forgot to grab mustard but was fine by itself.  Uncertain if I'll be back.

zcjdnfXaPn9Y6rzFJeIwFg.text: It's not fancy. Actually kind of gives me flashbacks of an old burger place I used to go to as a little kid back in Nebraska. Put a big smile on my face when I walked inside Zack's.  My order: cheeseburger, chili dog and onion rings. Hey, I'm getting my wisdom teeth out in the AM and I am in the middle of a 30 day challenge at my gym. Trust me, I deserved all of that. And yes, I did eat it all.  The onion rings... oh dear God. Tremendous. The burger was okay. The chili dog was great. I really liked the flavor of the chili. Dirt cheap. I think I spent around seven bucks.  I waited all of about five minutes for my food. The super sweet woman at the counter wished me luck on my wisdom teeth.  My one regret is that as I was walking out I noticed a couple sitting outside with drinks. I did not realize they have the good ice! You know what I'm talking about... the crushed up kind. It should be mandatory for all restaurants to have the good ice.  Thank you Zach's for a tremendous last meal before I go to the dentist. There's a reason the place is always packed. Keep doing what you're doing!

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger, chili dog and onion rings

LbYMfPjhHZjVKlFEigIifw.text: WOW!  Went for the unknown and had the kimchi burger........may I just say YUMMY! If you like jalepeno burgers give this a shot. Slightly spicy with an underlying tangy flavor and goes so well with hand cut fries or the house chips. The atmosphere is designed for group gatherings and if I didn't have a meeting scheduled I would have stayed a lot longer to sample one of the amazing selection of beers. Staff was professional and well versed with local info for those from out of town. Great place and will definitely come back!

_jQoESHMBaj1XY8F-VED9Q.text: Yeah, the burgers are not good and the fries were the type that you better eat while they're hot!!! Wanted to try it, now I have. Won't be going back. As another yelper mentioned, I had to choke 3/4 of the burger down. The register woman was non-chalant and didn't seem grateful for the business!! They will stay in business for ppl without discerning palates!!

ITkfMap2_ndSy7XwiNsU7g.text: I have been eating here for many years. I've tried other hamburger places that friends have recommended but always come back to Zacks. The Zack Special (dbl cheeseburger), ribeye sandwich, hotdog and onions rings are a must try items. And they are reasonably prices.

lFMEbs2yfMoLXg0mx4Wb1A.text: Since the demise of South 21 drive in on South Boulevard a few years ago, this is my go to place for classic drive in food that is not overpriced.  I started coming here in 1980 when I worked around the corner.  The Zack Special is just as good today as it was 38 years ago.  In 1984 I moved to the area and still come here occasionally.  Their trout dinner is almost exactly like the original South 21 version, the only difference is that the slaw is a little less vinegary but still close enough that I can eat a pint at one sitting.  The flounder dinner is actually better than most Gaston county fish camps, and the Zack Special hamburger still sets the fast food standards.  Zack is long retired, and I believe that his son George is not there quite as often, but the food is the star here without the Southend yuppiffied ambiance or prices.

aeGWnUXdh2nY8FOUdCdrxQ.text: Love the burgers at Zack's. Great burgers, the fries are also good and they keep the lines moving quickly. I wish they were open on weekends. Only complaint, but as long as that recipe stays the same, the stars remain at 5.

bTURuIj9W8slYvETL1cb3Q.text: This has nostalgia written all over it. It's like my Jerry's Drive In in Pcola. They are cheeeap. Double Zacks special cheeseburger and fries was like 5.75. It was good! Tastes like a burger off a flat top, not especially juicy but it is good. Fresh toppings. Cherry coke was fantastic  (like they make their own). I will go back due to prices and to try other things. This may be bumped to a 4 star review depending on next visit.

cwt7nRwhrVyAdecU9sntXQ.text: Tried Zack's for the first time last night and it was very very good. We were looking for classic burgers, Fries and shakes like old burger stands and that's what we got. Great prices too!

Mf7UqSPr6FiU4PCa6V67tA.text: Love this place!!! Get the zacks burger with extra zacks sauce. Seriously the best! Fries are good and sweet tea is good! Friendly staff. This is a Charlotte staple, you need to try if you haven't!

5FPRiHLzhhpYZZnNLPyqlw.text: Stopped in today for their Rib Eye Steak Sandwich and Onion rings.....DELISH......  Ready for a NAP......

27RR1jsZp-RRszc2dd6jgg.text: Yo this place amazing.  100% a top-5 option for best burgers in Charlotte.  Couple things: Its not a fancy, or really even that nice of a place. Its the standard "been here for a long time and we want to keep things like they were" kinda place.  The burgers are what your grandparents would start a story with "back in my day,"meaning they aren't pretentious with organic, locally sourced, or fancy Whole Food vegetables. It is just a really awesome burger.   Zach's is a Charlotte institution and you owe it to yourself to eat there at least once. It was also the scene of a key episode of Homeland (season 1) so you can channel your inner Carrie. That might be weird though. Just eat the great burgers.

oQRrvRrK6Q8pAuRLcBy1cA.text: This place is an old burger stand from the 60's. I love to find these treasures whenever I travel to new areas. This one could use a little TLC as it has a lot of clutter and faded signage. It obvious they do a good job serving classic burgers and BBQ, but some cleaning, organization and uniforms would go a long way towards taking this place to the next level. I had the Double Cheeseburger and Onions Rings which took me back to the 60's.

I wish the owner would consider a small remodel even if its fresh paint and revamp the tables and seating area. Its a classic diner i get it. But come into something a bitt neater, the diner deserves it and so do the patrons. Food is great, staff is friendly and have been working there a long time.  Keep up the great work!!!

Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Zacks Special....can you say yummy in my tummy

rivkPFKEdveWzE3pIGO_Bw.text: A throwback to days gone by burgers with real meat and great friendly service. This is a family owned business with two generation working their the food is also good. The hours are not as conventional as other burger joints of this era so you probably would like to look it up before going. The lunch hour gets really crowded. I'm in love with their onion rings they are exceptional. So do yourself a favor and go.

44lYFgf-adqdjTkfBx8XpQ.text: Been coming here since I was little!! 26 years and counting. George and Elaine are great people. The hamburger steak is a must have! Don't forget to try the Zack's special.

H33I42Yk1c_eOH-bpqZ_Dg.text: Zack's is a Charlotte classic! I grew up getting burgers here with my dad. They serve up the only restaurant burger I know that rivals, if not surpasses, a homemade burger. Zack's is a place that not only has character and history, but delicious food. The Zack's Special is my go-to order -- it's a burger with two patties, cheese, onions, tomato, pickle, and lettuce with a special sauce...simple and delicious. The shoestring fries are great too. The place is always busy so the fries are fresh and crispy. They even have the best ice in town too! Anyone who visits Charlotte or is a Charlotte native must visit Zack's.

Nso-ki-O1SeF7eSRh97qTQ.text: This is definitely top 3 places in Charlotte to get a burger, and when you factor in price, it may #1. Zack's special is my go to and the best thing on their menu. I would absolutely recommend this place.

sJ968-pngkGfwKzJy8hcqg.text: Absolutely delicious. I had a double cheeseburger, fries, and a root beer milkshake. I also recommend the BLT. Definitely a restaurant I will be returning to.

2dmILdoqxK5a-BaJy4XIvQ.text: Our family loves this place. Super clean, really good food (especially the burgers) and totally kid friendly. They are so nice here and love the neighborhood charm. It's like the bar that always knows your name and when if they don't, they make you feel so welcomed. Check out this local place. Really good food!

pZJ1Fbc_d2CvLwWlO5PsHA.text: Great hamburgers! Don't let outward appearances fool you. This place is classic. And awesome.  Cheap. Consistent quality every time we visit.

rea3IKGdRcCWFIb1CL8jHA.text: Best Burger in town! Unbelievable prices! We have been coming here for years. This is a family owned restaurant that has been around for years. George is always quick with a smile and conversation.

hrFp7HNYAoRzGBcDp2gmBw.text: Have been eating here since 1979. Greek family owned. Started wit the Zack's special and hot dogs all the way. Other great choice are Fried chicken and hamburger steak dinner. A Charlotte institution, you will not be disappointed.

YUks4AFKcFOQ4KioIJ5Fww.text: If you judge Zack's by looking at its location and overall retro look you'll be missing out on a great burger joint. It's been around for long enough that it's gained that vibe of early diners that just decided to not go with modern times.  As a child I came here about once a week to get "Zack's Special" though I couldn't really finish the huge portions back then. My dad and George the owner were on pretty good terms, mainly because they did some business together and George was always good to me. The food is definitely greasier but god it's so good. That special sauce on the Special is fantastic. You can't compare it to the Big Mac because it's just that much better. I don't live in Charlotte anymore but whenever I pass through I have an intense craving for Zack's.  The crowd is always a nice but strange mix of people all over from Charlotte. You'll see office workers in their suits, high school kids, families, etc. Even when the place is busy your order will still be served up in a timely manner.   The old-fashioned Zack's Special hasn't changed one bit over my entire life and it's definitely got that "all american" taste that you have to try at least once in your life! Skip the McDonalds and other fast food places and just come here for a burger and milkshake. You'll thank me once you've had a bite.

QyyKQ3G4a3XDhfmGADth1A.text: Can't believe how many times I've driven right by this place. Finally stopped in with my wife for lunch last week. What a cool little burger joint! I got the Zack's burger! Double patties, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion & special sauce (thousands island) with a side of onion rings. The burger hit the spot. The onion rings were fantastic. Crispy and light. Very affordable too.  For lunch, this place was packed but we still got our food in under 10 minutes. Yes, I'm a fan!!

rCA1v0WO3b6B8Ers_dbidQ.text: Zack's saved the day when the place I intended to visit was closed. I saw the sign and pulled right in. The place easily has one of the best hot dogs in town in my opinion. I saw someone with a ribeye steak sandwich. I'll be having that next time.

k10tBXhm6APKvG3Tg2pzzw.text: I just went there for the second time because the burgers were so darn good and cheap! My card wasn't swiping because it was scratched and I only had $6 on me so they took the cash and the manager told me I had 200 hours to come and pay the other $6. Obviously he was kidding. He even asked me if I wanted to keep the cash for gas or something. So sweet! I will be coming here even more now! First, to pay back my debt, and then for another burger!  These folks are good people.

MPYPQSgrvJosPe_A667sAg.text: My favorite since i was a kid! Zacks special is where its at! Mcdonalds stole their secret sauce!

Q9JAibakiRaaOXEERCse4g.text: Zack's is a great fast food restaurant with great burgers and awesome ice cream desserts that goes well after your meal

JMmW1fXUAqglKeNlz8IDsA.text: Just passing through town on layover. Good, classic, greasy American burger. Nothing fancy, but made fresh and tasty. Tomatoes tasted like they came from a farmer's market (this is what most fast food restaurants screw up) and were flavorful. A special sauce on the burger gives it a nice tang.

_BE1yMD0lmOVLSJzWKp5EQ.text: If you're looking for upscale, this aint it. Awesome burgers and milkshakes. Kind of reminds you of Arrnolds' from Happy Days. Only reason for 4 stars, I don't like their fries. Get the onion rings.

JVLArwlOcTdMppPE51fygw.text: OKay so some of my favorite reviewers have given this place really high stars so we decided we had to try it out. I'm going to be honest I was expecting something more I think. It's definitely nothing fancy and screams that small town feel of homemade cook out food. The burger was good but nothing great (still searching for that mind blowing burger). The hot dog was also okay but again nothing great. We ordered a chocolate milkshake and got a really weird chocolate malt instead. I'm not a chocolate malt fan so the feeling of let down was intense. I will say though... this place has the most amazing, perfectly cooked, perfectly greasy yummy goodness that are onion rings. If you are looking for fantastic onion rings look no further because they were on point. Does anyone even say that anymore?? I'm getting old haha... anyways I will come back and try some other things with my onion rings since the prices are right and the location is fairly close. I would give them 3.5 stars if I had the option but since I don't I will bump them up a bit :)

s9t_Pn-AuLvDipAFVg0ifg.text: Been waiting for awhile to try.  I had the special & onion rings, my partner the fried chicken & fries.  I would have preferred a McDonald's burger.  The fried chicken was made "fresh" & there was no flavor.  This was the location on South Blvd.

O6tiXLd70Xx-OmhMy_RLAw.text: This place is so delicious my kids go crazy and they are picky eaters and usually do not like dive food but their cheeseburgers her crate that Zack special is phenomenal I'm so glad we still have places like this where you can feed a family of four for less than $20

OrfDx1H5bZi8RaEaLCMPyQ.text: Great food and even better prices. Can't go wrong with the Zack's special or the Grilled Ham and Cheese. Yum!!

fQ6Pb6vABQsUJzlak9xjmA.text: Stumbled on this place entirely by accident, and it was a good time! Tasty burger and fries (had to try the Zack's Special) for cheap. My husband had the fried chicken, which he wasn't terribly impressed with- but I guess that's what you should expect ordering chicken from a burger joint. I wouldn't say this is the best burger in Charlotte (I'll save that distinction for the Penguin), but it's still pretty darned good- and the place has a cool classic dive feel to it.  Definitely worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood. I'd happily go again!

7htm8go1PMmuNP9GVpm47A.text: I think most cities and bigger towns have a place like this--an anachronistic throwback to days where beef wasn't "grass fed" and potatoes weren't "locally sourced." A place where food wasn't infused with "love," but instead was infused with salt. And grease. Lots and lots of grease.  And lo, it was good.  We've got a place like Zack's in Atlanta. No, I'm not talking the Varsity, though that would be a good guess. But I won't besmirch Zack's by comparing it to The Varsity. Instead, it reminds me of Zesto's, maker of the gut-busting Chubby Decker burger and milkshakes that will, indeed, get all the boys in the yard. Now to those not from Atlanta, please consider the comparison to Zesto's a compliment.  So yes, I dug the retro vibe of the place, a vibe not manufactured but entirely earned by not changing a whit in 40 years. The food? It was fine. Honestly, it wasn't the BEST burger I've had. I mean, my first paragraph kind of said it all. But don't consider that an indictment. Sometimes a greasy old-fashioned burger is exactly what you may need. In this case, it definitely was.

PlMf-cjsnDQtVbg3yDFFnw.text: Made my Friday and soon to be most lunch days.   Best burger I've had in quite some time.   A lost gem in Charlotte. This place is an instant classic from the layout to the menu.   They've mastered the art of doing something well vs an overloaded menu.   If you want an awesome burger that hits every spot,  hit this spot.

heSLN9plotBnUYC2DswXGw.text: I get it; Zack's has been serving up burgers since 1975. It still has the same old school charm it did back when it first opened its doors and from what I hear, the same taste. "No-frills", just a straight up burger made on a hot greasy top. I would suggest  getting the Zack's special! Fries were great! Definitely not a 5 star burger by any means, but I think the charm is why everyone keeps coming back; including me.  I get it now.

YDM0zOyRHDQ7V6iwUHEPHQ.text: Do not count calories and come here! Zack's is awesome, no wonder it's been around so long!!! I had the Zack's special with homemade onion rings and my son had the beef hotdog and fries.  Both were fantastic, full of flavor, and those onion rings were out of this world good.  I am not counting any of those calories today as food that good cannot be bad for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Worth every bite!

OQmxSevSREKRT-2KMg60Cg.text: Great burgers and fries! It was like stepping back in time to enjoying a great burger from my childhood. Think Happy Days meets The Maxx! Fresh food, good people, great vibes!

-UnaERj1sse9gAao5kXPng.text: Love their genuine food and hospitality, always go to Zack's when I am on that side of time.

fWIjP7RiuX_5Hh9cU1EtSg.text: You don't always need fancy stuff on your burger and a fancy chair to sit in or some themed place that's trying to attract the millennial crowd.  I've been here on multiple occasions and never disappointed. Onion rings are amazing

zO1hn6kaFEXpREKYBpjeIw.text: This place has GREAT food and a neat vibe. When we went it was super busy and we ate outside since it was so packed inside. The food was absolutely delicious! Don't let the old exterior run you off! You won't be sorry going here if you want a great burger!

vAxwL076JBaH-flD--ku7g.text: Seafood shrimp platter made me sick. Instantly. I asked the head chef what he thinks about their seafood. He said it was good. Planned the day to hang out with my friends  instead I had to go home and take care of an upset stomach. Customer service was excellent. But the seafood is horrible.

NrvtKKRsMk8u171GNRQP_Q.text: Zack's is a top contender on my everlasting search for the best burger in Charlotte. There are several things I love about Zack's. The burgers are delicious, the price is perfectly reasonable and the service is quick.   What makes the Zack's burger so great? To start the portion size is just right. I tend to get the Zack's special (two patties and two slices of cheese) and it tastes fresh and has a good ratio of fillings. I am full after eating my meal but not disgustingly stuffed as can happen with chain fast food places. The fries are delicious and always hot with a little bit of salt. The milkshakes are yummy too!   The decor is cute retro burger joint. The music playing in the background and the worker outfits go along with the theme. I do not appreciate, however, that they are not open on the weekends.   There is something to be said for an independently owned small establishment that has been making hamburgers so well that they have stayed in business for 40 years and can afford to be closed on the weekends. Next time you have a hankerin' for a simple but tasty meal try out Zack's!

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Zacks special served with a mountain of fries

a8wxSFW-E808rtJWsVY2sw.text: 5 star experience every time! Get the Zack's special if you're a Big Mac fan and don't skip the onion rings

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

bB4_uWVQ7SYtI5iTjfwbkw.text: This is my new go-to burger place- I'm going to have dreams about the Zack's special for years to come! Zack's is a great go-to spot to fill your burger cravings and the prices can't be beat! The Zack's special will run you around $7 and it is a massive double cheeseburger with all of the fixings and a healthy portion of fries. I definitely will be back to Zack's and I absolutely need to try their onion rings- they looked so good and I had instant regret that I didn't order them.   I love the atmosphere at Zack's because it reminds me of something out of the movie "grease". It's a classic burger place where you order at the window and they have a few booths and bar style seating that looks like it's strait out of the 50s. I love that they've stayed True to the original Zack's style.   Be sure to check out Zack's when you're in the mood for a low key, no frills meal at a great price!

KyTGfIO0UC1qJVhsbe6nnQ.text: While in Charlotte,  we stopped by Zack's after reading Yelp reviews. We were pressed for time so we kept it simple. The  burgers were good but not outstanding.  They lacked seasoning and the buns were hard and dry.  This is a good place to feed kids for fairly cheap.

xwJ9VEqDxlXxtMMwYZsBNg.text: We had our family reunion in Charlotte, NC 6/22-24/2018.  You know I will travel for a good burger.   We found Zack's listed as 5 on the top ten burger places.  The burger was fresh ground beef and it was very good.  The building wasn't inviting but those are the types of places that make the best food.....I tried to get another burger before departing but I didn't want to miss my flight!

kPMSolg6QbxzHkjjJCjOhg.text: I'm a bit of a burger nut, and especially love the old-school classics. This place is a must for someone like me. Based on other Yelp comments I got the Zack's special double patty cheeseburger. It's a good choice. Since I am A fan of the genre I can call it 4 stars.  The burger, while good, wasn't near the best as it was a little dry and tasteless. The cheese and condiments help a great deal and it's certainly fairly priced.  My fries were excellent.  I am from Greensboro and don't have much  Charlotte experience, but I would return here and would like to try the dogs, rings and shakes. It's a truly classic joint and one you locals should support.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Worthy burgers and fries

6UsfPHmr_gQXVjMauPf_Gg.text: I am here now @5:10 on 3/28 they had to remake my food because they had a hair in it food was remade And got a drink i for my trouble but still all I can see is that hair....."smh.....food wasn't bad tho....

S0z9JKaBfweUGwWQTjjGMg.text: Great atmosphere, a lot of food options and great service!  Definite low key lunch or dinner spot.  Only open on the weekdays.
