Y34B02p-PL0BP0Y3aKCDpQ.text: It is a nostalgic burger. It is the best classic diner-ish burger that you can get in Charlotte. Nothing fancy. Nothing crazy. It is just an all american burger that you MUST try.  Everything that I tried on the menu was good, but the burger, corndog, and chili cheese fries are my to-go. The staff are friendly, and the experience is always fun!

KotdOk82s1xevuZRPOLufg.text: Family run joint that reminds you of an old school burger shop, because it is. Owner/manager and his staff were extremely friendly and they moved quickly, especially with the line they had during the Friday night dinner rush. We'd brought the food back to our AirBnB, and it was still hot, not soggy or greasy at all. Wish I lived in CLT to go more often!

vd-rNgLPVu6YY8W9W2wDqQ.text: All you need to know is order the Zack's special!  Every bite of the double patty cheeseburger was fantastic served with french fries.  Honestly I have no idea of what I else is on the menu but it really doesn't matter since this should always be your go-to order.   It's pretty packed during lunch so worth it !!!

1P7SEnqtUvRWgG_wOK4bJA.text: How I've never been here as a Charlotte native and a 40 y/o man is beyond me and quite honestly I'm disappointed in myself.  Now that we have that out of the way let me just say you NEED to go here.  My wife and I visited during lunch time and I had the Zack's Special and she had a single cheeseburger with cole slaw and fries.  For me, it was love at first bite.  Just a great quality burger and toppings of fresh ingredients turned me into a burger fiend right then and there.  Beyond the fantastic burgers, they have nearly every menu item a diner of this age and genre should have.  Corn dogs, hot dogs, onion rings, etc.  The interior is perfect diner decor.  Orange bench seating, wood-like plastic laminate veneer tables and stools for those wanting to eat while at the windows.  They have exterior seating if the weather is good enough.    This is literally my new go-to for diner food.

J6U0EsKifCTnqMHWaKF3qQ.text: Zack's is the perfect, simple burger. Nothing fancy, nothing crazy, nothing innovative; but the genius is in that simple perfection. The restraint and consistency astound. The best True burger in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Zack&#39;s Special

AxuXv87YTCoN1M0oMjFd3w.text: First time here, quick lunch with my wife. Great spot, great fresh-cooked burgers and fries. Quick service, old school-type diner feel. Order at the counter and come back to pickup your food. No frills, but very good!  Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

btBX63nBfBuLdXteldihuA.text: Zack's were amazing! It was my first time checking out this Charlotte gem! I ordered the Zack special (double cheeseburger) with the onion rings and I was not disappointed! It reminded me of an old school drive in restaurant that I am used to from my home state of South Carolina. (shout out to 301 now called The Drive In located in Florence SC!) I will definitely be back!

AXtZmufQrd8RNBbKtJ4OcA.text: I have driven by Zack's for years and today I finally had the chance to check it out.  After reading other Yelp reviews I decided to try a few item: cheeseburger, hot dog and onion rings. Overall, the burger and fries were okay...and let me just say the special sauce is no comparison to In and Out, so if you are expecting that, sorry. But, the reason for 4 stars is for the service and Onion Rings. OMG, the onion rings are coated with a think fry batter, but it tastes light, no grease. They break as a good Onion ring should. A definite must. As for the service, although the place was packed they definitely have a system down so it moves pretty quickly and the servers are so sweet. A definite gem I recommend any one should check out.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

elxU11NsRciCOli5TggNhw.text: This is a "must" check out spot if you want a throwback burger experience. No frills or anything fancy, but a solid burger. You kind of taken back in time as soon as you walk through their doors, from the ads to the stickers on the door, everything takes you back in time, including the prices. Sure, it's not a .50 cent burger, but still very inexpensive for today's price point. We went with cheeseburgers and fries, which were simple and delicious. I'm not an onion ring person, but I will say those looked tasty as well.   All in all, definitely a spot to check off on your charlotte food map!

_AO_1o1oUhLuNQru1uO_Zg.text: Best burger in Charlotte!!! I order a single made like a Zach. It comes with one patty instead of two. Good old fashion burger, great milkshakes! I order onion rings instead of fries. The fries are good but there is something about their onion rings and that fried goodness!!  Good sweet tea too!!  Enjoy!!

a8f32LNxDP6rhqqDuQGJfQ.text: After living in Charlotte most of my life and having never tried Zack's before, I finally decided to try it after all of the hype. Maybe my expectations were too high because I was fairly disappointed.    The line was quite long and it didn't move very quickly. They could take a lesson from the old Char-Grill in Raleigh of letting people fill out their own order forms. There is a call in order option if you are getting take out.    I liked the size of the single burger - it was small enough not to be too filling.  The basic burger comes with ketchup, mustard, onions, pickles and Zack's special sauce. I requested no onions or mustard. The amount of ketchup on the burger was negligible and was Hunt's (second rate brand). The special sauce appeared to be a mixture of ketchup and mayo with very little flavor. There was a generous potion of pickles. Overall, the burger lacked any real flavor.  The fries were my favorite style - skinny. But even they disappointed. They needed salt and there were not cooked well. And they only gave two packets of ketchup (Hunt's) In my bag.   They do have the good ice that everyone likes for their drinks but I suggest requesting light ice as the cup was packed with ice leaving little room for the beverage.    So, If you want a Local, greasy spoon burger at a cheap price, I would recommend Mr. Ks or Brook's over Zacks.   If you want a fast food burger of better quality with lots of flavor and better choices of toppings and sides, head for Smash Burger, Bang Bang Burger or even the new addition from New York, Shake Shack.

s9ITPniXaSy-iF9xqxePtw.text: I am so glad I drove by this place. Classic burgers, fries, shakes and more. The interior is clean and the patio reminds me of a diner from my hometown. I had the cheeseburger, a cherry coke (grenadine here!) and onion rings. Hot and clearly hand battered, they were my fav thing, but it was all delicious. Super nice man at the counter who smiled at every customer despite long lines, and he never missed a beat. Can't wait to come back!

f1bixDXoAVvUyWzv57-irw.text: My coworker wanted to try this place for his birthday lunch. I can't believe I've never heard of this place before! When you walk up it looks like a place from the 60s or something.   When you walk inside the counter is right there and the line easily wraps around the side of the counter. Very limited seating so either come early or be ok with sitting outside! The service is pretty fast though so don't let the line intimidate you.   I got a corn dog with chili cheese fries. It was pretty tasty!! Plenty of chili and cheese and almost all the fries had some on it. Corn dog was great but it's hard to mess up a corn dog!!   My other coworkers got the burgers and they said they could've been warmer. The burgers are the thin kind. They also got the onion rings and said the could've been warmer too. They were good but a touch bland. I love onion rings so I'll have to try them the next time because other reviews have said they are tasty!   The food is cheap and good. If you are looking for a unique place for burgers, fries, and shakes check this place out!! Very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

IAOGlo3mvN9oQnP8EmoQmw.text: I cant begin to tell you how good my cheeseburger was , me an my friend ordered the cheeseburger an fries an shrimp plate to share. I dont recommend the shrimp get that at a fish camp. They are know for their cheeseburgers an onion rings an shakes fir a reason.  The burger was perfectly cooked an juicy an onion rings so crispy an hot hot lol They are not opened Sat/Sun so get your burger fix on during the week . They are busy but the staff has it under control. Call it in an pick it up lots of to go orders.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

ExCWaan2mno1JpeyN4pG1A.text: I went there for the first time in November 2018.  I just wanted a burger and I've driven past there several times over the years. It has an early 1960s atmosphere, but doesn't overdo it.  Ordered the Zacks Special w/o cheese.  The burger was as good as one of those $10 burgers.  The fries were as perfect as fries can be.  Then I decided to play food critic and get a hot dog and onion rings. The hot dog was marvelous. But the onion rings?  The BEST I have EVER eaten, anywhere, at ANY price!   Finally, went back and placed a 3rd order, for a chocolate malt milkshake.  That was ok, but a big letdown after the burger, fries, hotdog and onion rings.  I wish I lived closer to Zacks, but next time I'll try another burger with onion rings and/or fries, and maybe something else, but definitely skip the shake.

De8cIWbsR1ewbGMgaKWeug.text: Old school restaurant that welcomes you with great customer service. The staff were very nice while getting our order. According to your receipt number, the intercom will summon you to get your food, which I totally appreciate to not awkwardly look around and hoping every next food order would be mine as I could just sit at one of their many tables. Went through lunch hour with a good amount of people but still got our food within 10 minutes. They have great prices for such a quality burger. I'd say they have one of the best burgers in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

9kYdnbdTrXcidnd6XW44MQ.text: I don't get all of the fuss over Zack's Burgers, a frozen sub par quality patty with no seasoning on a dry bun with Big Mac sauce? This place should not even be mentioned in the same breath as Brooks Sandwich House.  Yeah, I get the price on the Zack's Special is good but you can get a better hand pattied burger at Brooks for less than Zack's machine stamped frozen patty. I will say that the onion rings were great at Zacks, and appeared to be hand breaded not frozen.  I did not order the special since I did not want frozen fries so I opted for the Double Cheesburer which I assumed was the same thing as the Zack's Special, NOPE, the double cheeseburger comes with double meat but NOT double cheese!  Food: 3 Sporks Service:  3 Sporks Atmosphere: 43 Sporks Sweet Tea: 4 Sporks Value: 4 Sporks

PxN9pnVN0E5vE_erL6KICA.text: Traffic location keeps it from 5 stars. But I'll deal with that just for the food.  YUM! YUM! YUM!  I can't believe how good these burgers are!! And the prices can't be beat!! It's an old drive-in/diner. You think you stepped back in time and a menu to reflect it. Don't let the look of the place fool you. Cheeseburger, fries, and milkshake were so on point, I got takeout for the family's dinner. They all asked where I got it & asked me to bring it home again!!  They've been here for years and now I know why. Definitely going back. Again and again.

XKTX_WDgN-6GCSbNwmQ0Ew.text: Came here for the first time with my boyfriend and fell in love!!!!! The food is delicious and loveee the old time feel! Got the Zack special with chili cheese fries!!! Omg!!! Can't wait to come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

LMzb11TDIh8ALTN2BVsK4g.text: I love this place. Great food. Had the fried chicken and it was SUPER crispy and juicy. Cole slaw and fries were good too. I love the atmosphere...very old school and chill. Employees were very nice & there was plenty of parking, even when it was packed. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy and great!

B_eDGTkfD1phV2OonHRdrQ.text: I wish I hadn't been so hungry because I finished my burger before I took a picture. My Zack's special was absolutely divine. Forget shake shack, forget smash burger, this place is my new favorite!

EhwzX7au5hqaaItbgH-JbQ.text: This place should be on Diners, Drive-in, and Dives! The classic burger joint vibes only add to their amazing burgers. The Zack's Special was great. What makes a good burger? The kind of meat, how it is cooked, the season? Whatever it is, they have nothing to worry about at Zack's. I was impressed with the simplicity and the fantastic flavor (and I didn't even mention the low cost). I would swing by this place for a burger any day.

qZDDfAqrk6PdwkEs1WSqAw.text: Zacks is one of my favorite lunch spots in Charlotte. The onion rings are very good golden and a little sweet. But I'm honestly in love with the hot dogs are to die for. the line can be really long at lunch time but they try and move you as fast as possible. I also love the shrimp and trout tray. it has an old school feel to the shop the bathroom is out back not t much has changed sine the business opened many moons ago as the old folks say

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

jBdVPvgxGxCGub7hAoV_ow.text: Good, simple, old fashioned burger, great onion rings... Utterly appalling and disgusting bathroom. Makes a back road truck's top seem like the Taj Mahal. .

iXTStwT4UoDsAB_wDY0d8Q.text: By far the best burgers in Charlotte! Great location, and convenient, fast-food speed of service. Would definitely recommend to all.

GutgM2SYdMNDOulVxd43tg.text: Good diner food.  Wasn't a fan of the shakes but the Zacks special is delicious!! Budget friendly and always packed during lunch!

aeImMUO9_GBbxJ9_t03AhQ.text: working in the area and Mr Matthews got a hankering for a Big Zack so here we are... As usual I had my lunch with me but something shakey and banana-ish sounded better than cold coffee so I went with that. $2.50 and five minutes later I'm looking at a 20oz cup of blended banana bits in soft serve thinking this is great! and it was too! I'm a fan of these throw backs, there has to be something other than marketing keeping them open for the better part of a century. Usually it's a well executed plan where the customer sees value in the cash-for-food exchange. It doesn't have to be gourmet (like that's even a thing!?) but it does have to satisfy, and the steady stream of foot traffic suggests that it does. I'll have to come down on a tourist trip and see how Zack's stacks.

l1FOGXWxxBFTOH2UzZSxpg.text: This place is a joke!!  I only ate here because my new co-workers brought me here on my last day of training before I came back home.    All they serve are some of the the simplest frozen foods made to order, Lol!!  Everything you order is cheap food, there aren't fresh fries from fresh potatoes, and who knows if the beef wasn't frozen either.  They serve carnival food, haha!!, and I wanna say that even our carnival food in Texas is gourmet compared to this junk.  I wasted my calorie count for the day on one crappy meal today.  Do yourself a favor and research this place before you come here.  Would have been better off going to freakin McDonald's!!  At least their cheap food would have tasted better.  Just look at the inconsistencies of their food prep and that should send a red flag.  Look for the inconsistencies in their onion rings alone, some look raw and some look well cooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. What a joke!!  Look at those cheap fries!!  Nothing gourmet about this place.  You get what you pay for.

gqtZdVQOAuyplz3EGHBiuQ.text: This place has a really cool aesthetic and really looks like a burger shop straight out of the 50's. The nostalgia factor alone is worth a stop, but I can't say I was really blown away with quality of the food. It was your run of the mill burger.  The way the line bunches at the door was also sort of annoying, but if you're dining in and want to feel like your grandparents did back in the day, stop in.

Wait9R2cyY5H9ivWeua-BQ.text: I decided to try Zack's based on the STRONG recommendation of a coworker. She basically said the 'best' burger in Charlotte is at Zack's so, naturally, I was intrigued and made a stop on a Friday afternoon for lunch.  Zack's is located right off South Blvd and in a spot that you just cannot miss if driving by. They have their own parking lot but just be careful when driving up because it's a small lot yet fits a decent amount of vehicles. I walked right in and got in line. From what I've heard, the line can wrap around the building but there was only about four people in front of when I got there. When you step inside, the line is formed to the left. Keep that in mind because there are a number of people hanging around the front waiting for their orders.  I ordered the Zack's special which comes with two patties (with no mayo) and a side order of onion rings because said coworker asked & insisted. For the Zack's special with fries, drink, and onion rings, my total came to $12 which I found very reasonable. I placed my order and waited around 5-7ish minutes before my number was called. I took my food and brought it back to work.  The inside is pretty small. There are a number of tables that surround the center order counter and a small table top with bar stools in the front. For warmer weather, there are a few tables outside. Just keep in mind that this is not a good place for a large group.  Unfortunately, I discovered my food was lukewarm, far from hot which was disappointing. The fries had no salt nor seasoning. The burger itself was good, I just would've preferred it warm. The onion rings were very crumbly because they were cold. I imagine them being a lot better if served hot.  I plan on making another stop at Zack's in the hopes that I will get a hot meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Zack&#39;s special (double patties)

EB0LR_8Sxtb6FxA2f0BoZA.text: I love the way this place is put together. They play oldies music and I love their set up. The glass in front of the kitchen and front counter gives you a classic feel. I highly recommend the Zack's special. Definitely order the onion rings because they are definitely handmade and they are amazing.  I love coming to this place on a rainy day to cheer me up.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

AJsni3EVwgkqmPizfjwrgg.text: This is a classic throwback burger spot, and a Charlotte landmark. Good food, fun atmosphere, and reminder of the character this city still has.

Bs15T-eJz9bkYdAVLx-avw.text: We're blessed to have this little slice of old school Charlotte still left. Food is solid and the people who run are even better . Thanks Zacks for sticking around!

gkwPXjuEjdofFBGMfZ4Xrg.text: This place has an old time drive in feel.  They have a wide range of menu options. The staff here is very friendly and willing to help.  You can either eat in the indoor dining area or at the patio in the front of the restaurant. I like the flaky onion rings over the beer battered ones. And was excited that they had the flaky ones. They tasted 'ok'. I have had much better. I also ordered the double cheese burger. The burger tasted fresh, but was not one of the best that I have had. They have a lot with ample parking. I was teetering between 3 and 4 stars but opted to go with the 3.  I would eat here again if I was in the area, but would probably not make a special trip there.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

lOX4opy388NbENCU8pgjGA.text: The feel and vibe is yesterday's old drive in and burger joints.  The line at lunch explains it ...  the food is good and the service is delivering at record pace...  I can't comment on much except the beef hotdogs and that's pretty much where I got stuck ... every single time they're delicious! My typical order is a chili slaw dog all the way with fries and a tea .... Someday maybe I'll be able to try something else but for now ..  it's my go to favorite ! It's a Charlotte landmark and I love it.  I've heard the Zacks special is fabulous... maybe someday I'll be able to try it ....

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. The line .... yes when&#39;s it&#39;s good food it&#39;s worth the wait !
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious chili slaw dog

RlHEaIaeu8seG55WRWzGwA.text: I really didn't want to be "that guy" that gave an established institution like Zack's a bad rating but it really didn't do it for me. I arrived towards the end of the lunch time rush and ordered the Zack's special, fries, and a corndog.   The burger was messy and not in the good way. My bread fell apart, the lettuce and other toppings gave the burger an "off" taste. The meat itself tasted bland, which was surprising because it looked awesome. It was really a let down because I thought this burger would set the new standard for what a burger should taste like. Absolutely not!   The corndog tasted like it was taken from the freezer and thrown into the grease. I am not sure if they make them in house or not, but it surely did not taste like it.  The fries were severely lacking in seasoning. I was given salt packs in my bag, but I feel that fries are best when salted as soon as they get out of the grease. They were a big let down, as well.   Also, the staff appeared as if they were ready to go home (which I can definitely understand) but it looked blatant. They were very short with the customers and not very personable at all. I was also almost given the wrong order. The lady looked confused when I told her this was not what I ordered. She looked at the ticket, took the food back, and never addressed me again until she called out my number for the correct order.   It was not a good first visit. Maybe it was an off day for them or my taste buds, but I wasn't impressed. I think I'll sit this one out from now on.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

4BsPGxd6baOkcbySBLEJ_g.text: Old timey diner feel, although not fancy.  Food is guaranteed to hit the spot every time!   Parking lot can be a bit stressful because its small for the amount of cars coming and going from Zach's. They have a HUGE lunch crowd!  Although, wait is not long - couple of minutes at the most.  They have it down to a science.  Good customer service.  If you're in a rush, call your order ahead and be sure to go to the call ahead line when you walk in.   What to order? As someone who grew up on Zach's, I ALWAYS order the Zach's Special with fries.  The Zach's special burger (the original Big Mac!) features two all beef patties, lettuce, cheese, tomato, onions, pickles and special sauce - a mouthful of wonderful with every bite.  Great value for the price - about $6 and some change.   They are not open on weekends.  The friendliest family owns this restaurant.  Support local!

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Zach&#39;s Special
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

OKhF2H6dVWcX_i2avU5ZGQ.text: Zacks is what I like to think all roadside burger joints used to be like before the McDonalds and Burger Kings of the world took over. A fun atmosphere with a retro vibe takes you back in time and you can still feel good supporting local business as this place has been around forever.  I was excited to stop by recently as their hours are somewhat limited on weekends and I normally work on the other side of town. I ended up getting the zacks special which is a solid choice (double cheese burger with special sauce) and opted for the onion rings as I had read they were good. Overall the meal didn't disappoint and I would certainly rate it a good value. I also appreciated some of the little things like how my wife had a cherry coke where they had to mix cherry syrup in to make it. Delicious.  Also be sure to check out the posters on the wall before you order as there are some cool things in there like photos of when Homeland shot one of their scenes there.

sb-UQbrrbbZzh1D51V_dcA.text: My husband and I basically drive passed Zacks every day as it's near our house. They are only opened Mon-Fri, so this passed Friday we had off and had to check it out.   Cute old school vibe. Limited seating but there are a few tables outside too if inside is full. It was definitely busy at lunch but they seemed to work through the line quickly.  We ordered a few things between my husband and I. Zacks Special was delicious. Sauce on it was great. Double cheese burger with sauce and a few other toppings. I usually dont like burgs like this but it was my fav. The fries that came with it were average. We also got a chili dog and onion rings. The chili is that thick beanless paste like that you would expect and was tasty. The onion rings were awesome....the batter was perfect. I also got a cherry coke. 1. there isn't a cherry coke fountain drink so I know they mixed something good together. it tasted like it. 2. They have that good good ice.   Overall, Zacks is a winner in my books. All the polls that have placed them top burger joint and people from tv shows that have filmed here (all of this is on their walls) also agree with me!

63LQn9gKJ2zPeYfPloMvxg.text: I decided to try Zach's because of all of the good reviews and was totally disappointed. I ordered a double burger minus the "special" sauce (the woman who took my order said it was 1000 Island Dressing). The burger itself had a strange taste and texture. It did not taste like real meat. I personally would rather eat a specialty burger from McDonalds than to go back to Zach's.  I am dumbfounded that Zach's burgers have such good ratings.

dR43K-TB2X_yYO_h74Y44w.text: OMG YUM! Now I'm no burger connoisseur actually quite the opposite, I eat super clean but every now and then I want a good burger. I drive by Zack's every day on my way to work. I was also a little intrigued by the old diner style but never really thought about it. Well Charlotte 5 sends me emails and i got one two days ago and it highlighted Zack's burgers. Since then I've craved one. So today I took the plunge and wasn't disappointed. I ordered the Zack's special and was given my number to wait to get called, the place was not very busy which was good there is ample seating but i took it back to work with me and sat outside.  I got my burger in about 7 minutes and it was amazing... the fries were fresh and not over seasoned and the burger was hot and fresh. Everyone's reviews are a little different and I'm sure the time of day and how busy they are can sometimes effect it but i had a great experience. I satisfied my burger craving fully! I would have got a shake too but i e probably already hit my calories for the day  Definitely worth checking out  !

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ordering window .. Ver y70&#39;s with the music and the uniforms. It&#39;s pretty great.
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Patio area taken from the bar window .
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Zack Special two cheese covered patties loaded up and great fries..   The picture does not do it justice ?

GXA1UF9jRSlPRUivrwwA1A.text: I visited Jack's for the first time today after recently relocating to Charlotte. I decided to dine in because I had some time to kill and it was still a bit wet outside from the previous days rain. The inside reminds me of an old diner meets food stand with decor dating back to the 1970's. There was memorabilia and famous photos all scattered along the walls and windows to gander at while you wait and eat. The place has been around since 1975 and you can certainly tell when you walk in.   All orders are places at the counter and it is self seating with 4 person booths and a bar area . I got the Jack's Special and didn't wait longer than 10 minutes before my hot burger arrived at the counter.  The food was just as expected for the price. It came hot and greasy fresh off the grill with a somewhat soft bun and toppings galore. The only trouble I had was that it was a bit messy and began to fall apart towards the end making it difficult to pick up. The fries were similar to those you would find at any bar. I had a sweet tea to wash it all down which was as sweet as the south makes it.  Overall I enjoyed my experience here and I am excited to go back and try more items. They have an outdoor seating area that I am excited to go back to enjoy once the sun comes back out

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

nSabF4S4rLJxOqzjLzgWgA.text: Great food. Quick service. My favorite is the trout dinner plate. The burgers are also delicious.

cLoksp99JMAMhCYLCasniA.text: I went here again and still think the food is pretty good. The Zack's special is my favorite.   The service is really fast, but it does get crowded at lunch so you may want to get there before 12.   There were a couple of things I didn't like about this visit. I ordered the Zack's special which comes with fries and I didn't want the fries, so I asked for no fries. They still charged me full price though and I would have hoped to get at least a small discount otherwise I might as well have gotten the fries and given them to someone else.   The seating is also not ideal for even small groups. The booths are really small so it's hard to fit more than two people in them.  The burgers are simple, classic burgers and they are good. I'll continue coming back when I'm looking for a good classic burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States. Zack&#39;s special
Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

P7rOZMaKFQVmTJc4bkxa0w.text: This is really 2.5 stars, rounded up. Came here after reading all the raves about the burgers and onion rings. Ordered the double cheeseburger and rings. Waited long enough that I expected everything, especially the rings to be inedibly hot.  Boy, was I unpleasantly surprised. Rings- heavily breaded and room temp. Tasteless would have been an improvement...they were just bad. Burger - overdone skinny hockey pucks. And cold. The burger that won 8th best IN THE FREAKIN COUNTRY.  Really, the 2.5 stars are for the bun (soft, fresh, yummy), the sweet tea (with those little pellets of crushed ice) and the ambiance of old school burger hoints whe nbn a burger was 15 cents. Which is about what this one was worth.  Much better example of this kind of burger is Brightstar Grill in Mt. Holly. It's been a while since I've been to a restaurant that failed to live up to the hype as spectacularly as Zack's. Here's hoping I just got a one-off bad meal.

uH6GgIH6QrO65rmy2DqfgA.text: I love that this old fashioned burger joint is right down the road from where I live! My family and I have been coming here most of my life and its always great food and fast service no matter how packed they are. Why would you ever stop at Wendy's or burger king when this place is nearby. The here food is ten times better and reasonably priced.

r8ULYqdcrq9cVzPe496bBQ.text: Zack's is the very definition of a neighborhood hamburger joint. Located on the corner of South Blvd and Scaleybark Rd, they have some of the best burgers in town and are a great Cheap Eats lunchtime destination. Being from Charlotte I have grown up on the Zack's Special( The Anti-Big Mac) a double patty burger topped with their own special sauce accompanied by a side order of some of the most perfect onion rings imaginable. Top it off with the Banana milkshake and your in heaven.Do yourself a favor and checkout this local landmark.

qGF38Wclw3Mwi7f9PwrEjQ.text: First visit I tried a cheeseburger & onion rings. Basic cheeseburger doesn't come with lettuce or tomato but was very tasty. The onion rings were overdone, dry & tasted like they had been sitting around since lunch. Second visit I tried the Zack's Special which is similar to a double double from In 'N Out. Zack's special comes with french fries which were fresh crispy & hot. I wouldn't say their onion rings are anything special as they advertise, but Zack's is an excellent choice for a tasty greasy burger n fries.

Qa6EX20YoG8kuYvqMNgczw.text: Zack's has the best hamburgers in the Queen City.  Walking into Zack's is like walking into a time warp where people trust know, and genuinely like people and want to serve them the best food possible.  Zack's is owned by the Demopolous Family and they know how to make their burgers.  Located at the corner of South Blvd and Scaley bark, Zack's has been doing their thing since 1975.  get the Zack's special, some onion rings, and a thick homemade milkshake, I like the vanilla and the strawberry shakes MMMMM.  Zack's is soooo Good, you have to try them.  get this, the first time I went there, I didn't have any cash, and they did not accept credit cards, so they offered to write me an IOU.  This is the first time someone has ever been nice enough to offer me such a nicety, how trusting, how kind.  I went to the nearest ATM, but I truly and wholeheartedly appreciate that jester of humanity and understanding.  That 's just the kind of place Zack's is, family oriented, and serving  the best hamburgers and sides in Charlotte. Zack's special, try it!

UuHNynZdg9F2VTwxvOAVPA.text: Was driving by, saw the sign and a crowd - decided to stop. Fun place, great hamburgers and onion rings. Very friendly atmosphere. Good value, worth the visit and I will return.

DMnU35vjnK_23MSdbjCoaQ.text: I go to Zack's for lunch at least once or twice a month. I was getting the Zack's special with fries but the last few times have been getting it "Carolina style" (chili and slaw). Wow. Lunch should be fast, consistent and a good value. You'll get all three here. Throw in very nice front counter staff who refill your drink quickly and you have a winner for lunch in the $7-$8 category. Even as busy as this place gets, I've never had a problem grabbing a booth and now as the weather gets nicer, enjoy the outdoor patio.

wdBxDW_pi8itKZ15DmBueQ.text: It doesn't look like much from the outside; in fact, Zack's looks like it's in need of a facelift, but don't let that deter you. Zack's makes some of the best burgers in town. Quick, relatively inexpensive, and absolutely delicious.   Try the Zack's Special; basically it's what a Big Mac should taste like, if McDonald's were actually in the business of making real burgers. And it's probably cheaper than a Big Mac, too.   Zack's is no-frills. No fancy menus, no fancy sauces, just good old-fashioned burgers and hot dogs and fries done right. There's also fried chicken and ribeye sandwiches to be had; I might have to sample them the next few times I go back to Zacks's.   In short, Zack's is an institution, and rightly so. You don't stay in business this long by making bad burgers.

BtOI0B_F1ctO6q-IRRNQjg.text: my husband took me here yesterday for the first time. the food was delicious. love their cheese fries - the cheese is unlike anything i have ever tasted. not only is the food great, but the atmosphere is relaxing. nice 50s music playing in the background - i forgot that i was sitting in the middle of busy charlotte!

0FQlxWvqFiO10GajLuDl2A.text: Zack's Hamburgers has the best hamburgers around! They prices are cheap and they have a friendly staff! We have been going to Zack's for years and will continue to go! My Favorite is the Zack Special with a chocolate shake!

P82EopTIT6Kd4RInLclkGA.text: Zacks - good ole fashioned hamburgers. You cant beat the burgers here... as well as the prices. Good family run place that cares about the service/product they give. I always order the cheeseburger and fries, BF gets the zacks special w/o-rings.  We order lunch from here a lot - they get BUSY during the day so I suggest calling in, even if you want to eat there. Went for dinner recently for the first time and was surprised how busy they were during the evening (not like lunch thou!) and turned one of my friends onto Zack's. Every time I eat here I think about when I am going to go back.

lWpMwWYyO0w9Nw48gX_Iaw.text: Cheap Tasty Burgers is the name of the game here.  It looks like a old Burger joint from the 70's and still feels like it.  I'll make your ordering decision for you. "Walk up get their special."  There done.  If you came here for a burger, you'll be happy.  There fish and chips looked real good too, I'll be back to try them soon.

x4fq1bK6JRExXDbtP-HTKA.text: Yummy in your tummy for $5ish... I'm in  No idea why nobody told me about the best hamburger joint in town but I was driving by and couldn't resist.  this spot's been around since at least the 70s and they make a burger the way i imagine it was done in the good ole days.  Get a Zack's special, it's what a Big Mac looks like in the commercials - made to order with real beef.  For less cha ching.

fPsIweU9SLKYfoiMYphpgw.text: Wow this was my first time at this burger diner and it was awesome . The cashier was super friendly and despite of how old the building is it is very clean. My burger was very juicy and taste amazing. The fries and Onion is a must item. I wasn't impress with the ice cream with fried apple pie  but everything else was awesome . Next i want to try the ribeye sandwich...

8rIhTc0qHEY5s2QdxQltTg.text: Cheap, fast delicious hamburger can't complain, seat yourself style and also i always get the zack's special, must try.

vx776qUWclXpla8zdpNe2g.text: Last couple times I got a milkshake. ..it wasn't good at all... would still go for the burger. .. fries are ok.

tgxX0AqZgK0hZgUN6eGQjQ.text: Quick, delicious, has an old-timey diner feel. My only complaint is that they are closed on weekends and that I didn't discover it sooner! Turns out my grandmother used to eat with friends here back in her day. :)

GLayyxUw8Arw-roOFQHKmQ.text: I read the reviews and was excited to try this place.  They did not disappoint.  I ate the Zack's special.  The double burger patties were delicious,  all the right condiments, melted cheese, good bun and it was cooked very quickly.  This is definitely a home cooked burger style over your chain burger or thick pub burger but incredibly good.  Best in a while! Can't beat the price either!

xQZ65FqOsl4511Q4AbE2DQ.text: Head over to Zack's Hamburgers on South blvd (behind the gas station) and snuggle up with one The Zack's Special burger. You get two ground beef patties with two slices of american cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickles, onions, mayo, and special sauce on a toasted bun. Zack's has been serving their special since 1975 and if you're craving a simple burger with no frills or complications they have one of the Best Burger in Charlotte.

Pa1uV4SGuAeiVjUQYNaFGA.text: I am from New Jersey and stopped by Zack's Burger during my visit to Charlotte and it was AWESOME. Everything is fresh and such an old school feel to the place! Just like an old time diner. I recommend it to anyone!!

IZmzP47q46IQF4EUJSjqCQ.text: Five stars indefinitely! This place doesn't look like much, but the food is delicious! The hamburger makes me think of in and out burger (from California) but bigger. I got Zach's special which is a good amount of food for under $6.

nkEcu7nQAttidCOQBfU2sg.text: Some of the best burgers in Charlotte. I can bring my whole family there and eat for quite a small investment. I've gone there for years and really enjoy the Zacks special

wvU0lSr0J-fbY5OQoew2_w.text: This is a neighborhood staple. Exceptional food, cheap eats, and fast friendly service. Don't expect a lavish burger, but this is a go to burger joint.

pB5GBuGoKyPTOQgU8AMX5A.text: Ahhhh Zack's. I wish I could eat here more often without gaining an extra hamburger (or 3) weight. So glad they've taken credit cards, as before it was cash only. I usually only get the hamburgers, which are pretty darn good. The place is the size of my thumb, but that doesn't take away from how good and "dinerish" the food is. The milkshakes, fries and onion rings are delish. The staff reminds me of diners back home- a strange assortment that works! And the best part? The prices! A lot of food for a super deal of a price.

CvW9LvM1wZIrxciusoxE0A.text: Zack's Hamburgers is a great place.  Their special hamburger has two patties, special sauce(thousand island style), iceberg lettuce, American Cheese, pickles, and onions on a sesame seed bun...sound familiar?   If you live in Charlotte you definitely need to check this place out.  This is what I would imagine McDonald's to be like when it first opened.

aKOmi1d2iR52UBOjDoRbZw.text: We had good old-fashioned burgers and fries. Walk-up, place your order, wait 5 minutes and you are treated to a fresh hamburger, thick and juicy, with crispy fries that taste like potato, not flavored oil. Very good food, the place is naturally retro, and it all works. I would bet most everything else is pretty good too!

YBkY4dw5ZZrjJy8UAiDFDg.text: Delicious and cheap, the zack special is a much bigger and more delicious version of the Big Mac.

19bwtydMnGGj90pyPSR4dQ.text: I am a frugal, frugal Puerto Rican. The joint was clean and bright, prices were fair sans drinks. Food cooked to perfection and fries crispy, all presented on a Styrofoam plate (tsk tsk). No soggy lettuce or soft pickles. I'm not going to comment on aesthetic or uniforms, that's ridiculous. Was it worth my money? Yes, absolutely.

egj15ISByw4Jg8ZKRx3Znw.text: $15 for two meals with drinks, delicious!! Friendly staff, good food, very old school at atmosphere. The place was poppin and the line kept growing as we dined in. Will return!

ceEe348KuXobXrWSSAMjZQ.text: 4.5 stars is probably the sweet spot, but fuggit, let's give them 5.  Drove by this spot quite a few times getting around in Charlotte, but decided to stop by after a round of golf with some buddies.  This place is awesome.  Lemme break it down old school for you.  Ambiance:  Gotta love the Elvis music playing, old posters on the walls and the general retro-style to it.  However, it's not retro-style, per se, like Johnny Rockets.  This place actually is retro bc it's been in business forever.  Came in around closing time so the owner was pretty cool.  We chatted it up about this and that, places here and there, everything and nothing.    Food:  Solid burgers, fries and onion rings.  He made a bold claim that they are the east coast In'n'Out... I can't give him quite that, but it's almost there.  The produce was fresh, the patties were cooked to perfection.  And ICE AFICIONADO ALERT* They have the crushed iced with drinks... That ice is literally the best ice ever.  Price:  Dunno, didn't have to pay--I won the golf bet ;)  Will definitely keep this place in mind after a round of golf or when I'm jonesing for a burger.    dmo out.

rGGx7XT_u8XH2c4VaXoxpA.text: This place has been a staple in Charlotte since the 70s. Tucked away behind the gas station on the corner of Scaleybark and Woodlawn, they serve some of the best simple burgers, hot dogs and shakes in the city. As I have seen more and more gourmet burger places open, it is often good just to be able to get a simple grilled burger with the fixin's. Zack's is family owned and operated and serves good food and good value. My personal favorite is the Zack's Special which comes time a double patty burger with Zack's special sauce and fries. I usually add a milkshake and find myself still under $10. My friend is big fan of their hot dog special and last time there I ran into a guy who has neeer felt a reason to veer away from the Rib Eye Steak Sandwich. You can also find fried fish, onion rings, chicken tenders and a host of other things would expect to find at this classic burger joint. Next time you are craving a burger and don't feel like paying $12 or swinging by McDonalds, give this place shot.

Xz3hy4cJt2yVoN9TIgRsNg.text: My favorite burger joint in Charlotte. Made to order burgers, freshly made onion rings, great french fries and ice cream shakes.

zGgzk4V3zwo8hMmKzeRF3g.text: Amazing burgers and the onion rings are an overwhelming must. Fries are good too but the onion rings take it. Cole slaw is a little too vinegary for my taste but okay. Desserts were nothing special - go for the handmade shakes instead. Will definitely come back but have to check the limited hours first before making the trip. Still though. - great ol' traditional burger dive! Employees were friendly and they know how to crank out the food and get you through the line quick.

dzgpjbKn5n-7S9etuWBSCg.text: I had high high hopes after reading all the reviews for this place.  I have to say it was worth it.  For around $5 you can get a double cheeseburger with tomato, onion, pickle, mayo, lettuce and fries.  Delicious.   I went for lunch and read a previous tip to get there early and that was definitely True.  By 11:45 there was a line at the counter and shortage of booths.  Go early and check out this Charlotte institution.

ghxyc16RfFwRl9Rt-RkuAg.text: It's not a fancy joint but it's a 5 star establishment in its respective class of restaurants. The actual setting is cool and it's neat how old the place is. It feels like you're in the 1950s. The pictures inside are fun to look at and it's clear that Zacks has been a dedicated member of the Charlotte community. The prices are unbeatable! The milkshakes rock! The burgers and fries are the same price as McDonalds but taste WAY better!! Go to Zacks for a cheap unhealthy satisfying meal!

K7oL3rPHM3sHVRjK4BQiDw.text: My favorite dirty boy cheeseburger in all of Charlotte. The Zack's Special is a must for only $5.25. They also have fantastic corn dogs, milkshakes, onion rings and the drinks have the good ice as well. Has been there since 1975 with a unique red and white awning. This place is a Charlotte staple, the only con is that they are only open Monday-Friday but are open for both lunch and dinner.

IyhgIZaDmNBix6BBeaQp1Q.text: Fantastic little diner! Amazing retro, original, atmosphere, great food, and kind staff! All the food is great, big menu but not too many options, just right! My first time here and I'll definitely be coming back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Zack's Hamburgers - Charlotte, NC, United States

3XA7UOSO6LITtnMOU0EZTw.text: There's nothing flashy, trendy, or even remarkable about Zack's. They don't throw any fancy slogans out or use some sort of dated jargon to describe their outfit. It's just burgers, fries, rings, shakes, and the best crushed ice in all of the Earth's history.   The Zack's Special -- Double cheeseburger, lettuce, tomato, mayo, pickles, mustard, easy like a Sunday morning bun. It's like the king of all lunchroom burgers. Nothing that's going to blow you away, but familiar like an old friend. Just right.   Fries are nothing to shake a stick at.   Onion rings, however? Sheer greatness.   Also, for the price of $10 for two, you can't really be upset. I'm glad that Zack's is around and has been doing the same thing for so long. Don't change a thing, fellas.

_dhJgvXsxUy9N27KVWdb7A.text: Cool Old Place!  Reminds me of a time that if I was part of I do not remember!  The celeb photos on the glass, pretty cool.  Dirty outdoor (outside like an old Gas Station) Mens room does not bother me though it could have, though no baring on the rating for my review.  Great Service!  The place was busy and the lady answered my questions very well!  I'm not rating the less than one yelp star Onion Rings because they were less than one yelp star and they also are not going to bring my review any lower!  Here it is:  The water I drank was perfect and the Hamburger was prepared exactly as I ordered it!  The Hamburger gets 3 yelp stars because it was good for the price, it was made right and it had good (not great ) flavor.  I ate the whole burger and I was hungry (breakfast at 4:00am and this lunch at 2:00 pm).   In this case three yelp stars means I won't be back, only because I like other options better!

djl0LIbD6A3_Rlb5R428xg.text: Came here for the first time yesterday for lunch and had the Zack's special with fries and a medium drink, came to 7.55$ after tax . Burger was juicy , fries were hot and everything was delish . Will definitely  come back again and try some of the other menu items .  The place has been open for about 40 years , love to see local businesses  thriving in the area .

QZiXXd0DP1xAFMr095XDGQ.text: Zacks is LITERALLY on my street. I can honestly say I do not eat here enough. I love the old vibe of this place. The food is always good. Hot and fresh, cooked to order. Chili cheese fries  you can't go wrong here. It definitely reminds me of an old soda shoppe. I'm absolutely obsessed with the BBQ sandwich. Great place!

k6WbX1akoA8pudHaxsyBdQ.text: Good prices, and all the employees seemed to be busting their butts. I didn't particularly care for the food, by maybe I'm just not a huge diner food person - I tried the Zack's special (double cheeseburger with fries). I love burgers, but thick enough that you can get them less than well done... just a preference thing.

xcViYDt5_rhMz5lWNVc6Pw.text: Best onion rings.... Very good burger can be better if it smells less meaty Great special sauce...fries needs to cook further lacks the crunch!  Would / will eat there again and I recommend it.

7Rl-lOCUDw72qu-aOkD2TA.text: Great throwback burger joint. The Zack's Special is the way to go for quality and price. Burger ranks right up there with the best.

6vtk43yOorN7PByXuxb2IQ.text: Get the Zack's Special!  I had this burger over a year ago and finally had the chance to be back in Charlotte. This was one of my bucket list items.
